Tasks.Task Description: Identify the goals and objectives for using Azure Event Hubs in analytics. Determine the data sources, expected throughput, and analytics requirements.
Analyze the volume, velocity, and variety of data to be ingested into Azure Event Hubs. Identify the sources and formats of data.

Tasks.Task: Design Event Hub Namespace and Configuration
Tasks.Task Description: Plan the namespace structure, partitioning strategy, and throughput units based on analytics requirements.
Create the Event Hub namespace and configure the Event Hubs with the required settings, such as partitions and throughput units.
Configure access control using Azure Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) and Shared Access Signatures (SAS). Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit.
Set up connections to data sources for ingestion into Azure Event Hubs. Configure producers to send data to Event Hubs.
Set up consumer groups to enable multiple analytics applications to process data independently.
Connect Azure Event Hubs to analytics tools such as Azure Stream Analytics, Databricks, or Power BI for real-time or batch processing.
Set up monitoring for Event Hub metrics such as throughput, latency, and errors using Azure Monitor. Configure alerts for critical thresholds.
Perform end-to-end testing of data ingestion, processing, and analytics workflows to ensure the system meets requirements.
Analyze system performance and optimize configurations such as partitioning, throughput units, and consumer group settings.
Create detailed documentation of the Event Hub setup, including namespace configuration, security settings, and analytics workflows.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Event Hubs and analytics workflows.
Ensure the setup adheres to regulatory compliance requirements. Implement auditing procedures to verify data security and privacy.
